issue.title: fix(webapp): disable inline font
issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> I'm rephrasing what I understood: Even with inlining, there is font flickering in the browser because the inlined font is not used (greek-ext charset), and the fonts that are used are not inlined. If that's not correct, please correct me.

I think we are talking at cross purposes. The inline does not directly have anything to do with the font flickering.
The inline technique is to save traffic and requests. This is helps for http1.x which has limited concurrent requests.
Also it saves some unnecessary traffic because for file sizes <2kByte the additional http header are about 1kByte. So there is more overhead and content.

The font flicker is caused by the the css property `font-display: swap`.
This enables the browser to start rendering the page as fast as possible. The browser starts rendering the page even if the custom font is not loaded yet. So the webpage is quickly shown with the minimal amount of traffic (good at low bandwidth).
Later if the custom font is loaded the website is rerendered with the custom font. This causes the flicker.

You can find multiple pro con discussions online about this topic.

One solution is to preload the initial shown fonts with the ` <link rel="preload"`. (Not sure how to do this.)
The other solution is to sacrifice the fast rendering and switch back to the default behavior  `font-display: block`. 

To get back to your question: I do not know what impact the inlining of the font has, but the two above solutions are the common and straight forward options.

issue.title: Only clone necessary part of git repository dependency  (`--depth`)
issue.body:
- [x] **Feature Request**.
- [x] **PlatformIO Core**.

### Configuration

**Operating system**:
Win 10, Visual Studio Code
 
**PlatformIO Version** (`platformio --version`):
PlatformIO Core, version 6.1.5

### Description of problem

If a dependency is a tag on a git repository, the complete git repository is cloned. Depending on the repository the traffic and amount of files can be huge. This causes a long transfer and processing time which decreases the user experience.

Git repositories are used for development built and testing.

Example  `platformio.ini`:
```yaml
[env:heltec_wifi_kit_32]
platform = espressif32@^5.2.0
platform_packages =
  ; use a upstream tag
  framework-arduinoespressif32 @ https://github.com/espressif/arduino-esp32#5b61930bb732d70f8aaa650047b9752365c9698c
framework = arduino
board = heltec_wifi_kit_32
```

### Actual Results

Traffic: 2.4GByte

### Expected Results

Traffic: 260MByte
-> 10 times less

### Solution hint

If possible use the `--depth=1` argument from `git` to only clone the necessary files.
Ref: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone

issue.title: fix(webapp): disable inline font
issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> Your measurements (fix(webapp): disable inline font #630 (comment)) indicate that disabling font inlining gains about 0.4s to first contentful paint.

The time reduction comes from the traffic reduction from 767 KiB to 696 KiB.

> However, even with inline fonts currently enabled, I do see the font being replaced shortly after first contentful paint, so there is flickering despite of font inlining.

There is no explicit `font inline` function. It is the generic webpack function: inline tiny files to reduce request to server.

> That indicates that the inline font is actually not used for the first contentful paint.

Yes, you are right.

>  or because the browser doesn't use it for another reason, 

The reason is that not used fonts char-set (greek-ext)  are inlined.

>  in which case the question is why the technology exists at all.

Because webpack makes the decision to inline only by the file size.

commits.message:
fix(api): update credentials_changed when (unused) TOTP is created

Previously, credentials_changed was only updated when the factor was
first verified. As a result, when an activation link was clicked
twice, the state was unchanged, so the action would attempt to create
the factor again, causing a uniqueness error.

Our `exception_handler` (exception_handlers.py) correctly turned this
into a 409 response, but the ugly database message was exposed, and
an admin email was triggered.

With this commit, the auth action state is invalidated immediately
when the TOTP factor is created.
fix(docs): trailing slash was missing for zonefile/ endpoint
fix(api): properly test and document login failures
fix(webapp): don't force MFA redirect on 403 due to login failure
feat(dyndns): allow preserving IP address, fixes #445
fix(webapp): correct return type of validation rule
refactor(webapp): code style, including new slot syntax
feat(docs): link zonefile export in bulk operations
feat(webapp): stay logged in on public pages, closes #619
fix(webapp): fix no-data slot positioning in domain view

issue.title: CI: Replace deprecated and non-functional travis-ci.org
issue.body:
travis-ci.org stopped working since June 2021:

> Since June 15th, 2021, the building on travis-ci.org is ceased. Please use travis-ci.com from now on. 
> - https://travis-ci.org/github/primefaces/primeng

This means that pull requests and other branches are not built and tested, thus creating a risk for code quality and reproducibility for this project. I suggest to either set up https://app.travis-ci.com/github/primefaces/primeng (note the other domain name) or switch to [GitHub actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions).

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

comment.body:
Yes it is still possible to pin to start with windows. But the underling technique are changed.
Microsoft is now are more committed to standards and PWAs.
They launched the test and support page https://www.pwabuilder.com/ .

If you dig into the documentation, you will finally find the following document with the corresponding resolutions:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/progressive-web-apps-chromium/how-to/icon-theme-color

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

comment.body:
I think (couldn't find a lot of information) at the time it was added, the yandex browser was not chromium based and so used a unique icon size.

> it has a unique feature named [Tableau](https://browser.yandex.com/help/personalization/tableau.html).

Opera has a similar looking feature. Also the icons seem not to be squares?

I think Russian focused developers have much more detailed information on how the yandex browser currently behaves and can share it.

@me-no-dev Should I increase the column size? The limitation was on purpose because it is easier to read a table row without a huge space between the columns. Most SSIDs were shorter than 15 chars on my test setup.

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

issue.body:
### Related area

Example

### Hardware specification

All

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

Simple examples are often used for quick debugging or function testing.

But currently the output of the `WiFiScan` example is not very useful:

```
Setup done
scan start
scan done
17 networks found
1: IoTNetwork (-62)*
2: WiFiSSID (-62)*
3: B3A7992 (-63)*
```

It does not show what the esp32 board recognizes, like encryption or channel.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add more useful data to the output.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: fix(webapp): disable inline font
issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> I'm rephrasing what I understood: Even with inlining, there is font flickering in the browser because the inlined font is not used (greek-ext charset), and the fonts that are used are not inlined. If that's not correct, please correct me.

I think we are talking at cross purposes. The inline does not directly have anything to do with the font flickering.
The inline technique is to save traffic and requests. This is helps for http1.x which has limited concurrent requests.
Also it saves some unnecessary traffic because for file sizes <2kByte the additional http header are about 1kByte. So there is more overhead and content.

The font flicker is caused by the the css property `font-display: swap`.
This enables the browser to start rendering the page as fast as possible. The browser starts rendering the page even if the custom font is not loaded yet. So the webpage is quickly shown with the minimal amount of traffic (good at low bandwidth).
Later if the custom font is loaded the website is rerendered with the custom font. This causes the flicker.

You can find multiple pro con discussions online about this topic.

One solution is to preload the initial shown fonts with the ` <link rel="preload"`. (Not sure how to do this.)
The other solution is to sacrifice the fast rendering and switch back to the default behavior  `font-display: block`. 

To get back to your question: I do not know what impact the inlining of the font has, but the two above solutions are the common and straight forward options.

issue.title: Only clone necessary part of git repository dependency  (`--depth`)
issue.body:
- [x] **Feature Request**.
- [x] **PlatformIO Core**.

### Configuration

**Operating system**:
Win 10, Visual Studio Code
 
**PlatformIO Version** (`platformio --version`):
PlatformIO Core, version 6.1.5

### Description of problem

If a dependency is a tag on a git repository, the complete git repository is cloned. Depending on the repository the traffic and amount of files can be huge. This causes a long transfer and processing time which decreases the user experience.

Git repositories are used for development built and testing.

Example  `platformio.ini`:
```yaml
[env:heltec_wifi_kit_32]
platform = espressif32@^5.2.0
platform_packages =
  ; use a upstream tag
  framework-arduinoespressif32 @ https://github.com/espressif/arduino-esp32#5b61930bb732d70f8aaa650047b9752365c9698c
framework = arduino
board = heltec_wifi_kit_32
```

### Actual Results

Traffic: 2.4GByte

### Expected Results

Traffic: 260MByte
-> 10 times less

### Solution hint

If possible use the `--depth=1` argument from `git` to only clone the necessary files.
Ref: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone

issue.title: fix(webapp): disable inline font
issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> Your measurements (fix(webapp): disable inline font #630 (comment)) indicate that disabling font inlining gains about 0.4s to first contentful paint.

The time reduction comes from the traffic reduction from 767 KiB to 696 KiB.

> However, even with inline fonts currently enabled, I do see the font being replaced shortly after first contentful paint, so there is flickering despite of font inlining.

There is no explicit `font inline` function. It is the generic webpack function: inline tiny files to reduce request to server.

> That indicates that the inline font is actually not used for the first contentful paint.

Yes, you are right.

>  or because the browser doesn't use it for another reason, 

The reason is that not used fonts char-set (greek-ext)  are inlined.

>  in which case the question is why the technology exists at all.

Because webpack makes the decision to inline only by the file size.

commits.message:
fix(api): update credentials_changed when (unused) TOTP is created

Previously, credentials_changed was only updated when the factor was
first verified. As a result, when an activation link was clicked
twice, the state was unchanged, so the action would attempt to create
the factor again, causing a uniqueness error.

Our `exception_handler` (exception_handlers.py) correctly turned this
into a 409 response, but the ugly database message was exposed, and
an admin email was triggered.

With this commit, the auth action state is invalidated immediately
when the TOTP factor is created.
fix(docs): trailing slash was missing for zonefile/ endpoint
fix(api): properly test and document login failures
fix(webapp): don't force MFA redirect on 403 due to login failure
feat(dyndns): allow preserving IP address, fixes #445
fix(webapp): correct return type of validation rule
refactor(webapp): code style, including new slot syntax
feat(docs): link zonefile export in bulk operations
feat(webapp): stay logged in on public pages, closes #619
fix(webapp): fix no-data slot positioning in domain view

issue.title: CI: Replace deprecated and non-functional travis-ci.org
issue.body:
travis-ci.org stopped working since June 2021:

> Since June 15th, 2021, the building on travis-ci.org is ceased. Please use travis-ci.com from now on. 
> - https://travis-ci.org/github/primefaces/primeng

This means that pull requests and other branches are not built and tested, thus creating a risk for code quality and reproducibility for this project. I suggest to either set up https://app.travis-ci.com/github/primefaces/primeng (note the other domain name) or switch to [GitHub actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions).

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

comment.body:
Yes it is still possible to pin to start with windows. But the underling technique are changed.
Microsoft is now are more committed to standards and PWAs.
They launched the test and support page https://www.pwabuilder.com/ .

If you dig into the documentation, you will finally find the following document with the corresponding resolutions:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/progressive-web-apps-chromium/how-to/icon-theme-color

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

comment.body:
I think (couldn't find a lot of information) at the time it was added, the yandex browser was not chromium based and so used a unique icon size.

> it has a unique feature named [Tableau](https://browser.yandex.com/help/personalization/tableau.html).

Opera has a similar looking feature. Also the icons seem not to be squares?

I think Russian focused developers have much more detailed information on how the yandex browser currently behaves and can share it.

@me-no-dev Should I increase the column size? The limitation was on purpose because it is easier to read a table row without a huge space between the columns. Most SSIDs were shorter than 15 chars on my test setup.

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

issue.body:
### Related area

Example

### Hardware specification

All

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

Simple examples are often used for quick debugging or function testing.

But currently the output of the `WiFiScan` example is not very useful:

```
Setup done
scan start
scan done
17 networks found
1: IoTNetwork (-62)*
2: WiFiSSID (-62)*
3: B3A7992 (-63)*
```

It does not show what the esp32 board recognizes, like encryption or channel.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add more useful data to the output.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> I'm rephrasing what I understood: Even with inlining, there is font flickering in the browser because the inlined font is not used (greek-ext charset), and the fonts that are used are not inlined. If that's not correct, please correct me.

I think we are talking at cross purposes. The inline does not directly have anything to do with the font flickering.
The inline technique is to save traffic and requests. This is helps for http1.x which has limited concurrent requests.
Also it saves some unnecessary traffic because for file sizes <2kByte the additional http header are about 1kByte. So there is more overhead and content.

The font flicker is caused by the the css property `font-display: swap`.
This enables the browser to start rendering the page as fast as possible. The browser starts rendering the page even if the custom font is not loaded yet. So the webpage is quickly shown with the minimal amount of traffic (good at low bandwidth).
Later if the custom font is loaded the website is rerendered with the custom font. This causes the flicker.

You can find multiple pro con discussions online about this topic.

One solution is to preload the initial shown fonts with the ` <link rel="preload"`. (Not sure how to do this.)
The other solution is to sacrifice the fast rendering and switch back to the default behavior  `font-display: block`. 

To get back to your question: I do not know what impact the inlining of the font has, but the two above solutions are the common and straight forward options.

issue.title: Only clone necessary part of git repository dependency  (`--depth`)
issue.body:
- [x] **Feature Request**.
- [x] **PlatformIO Core**.

### Configuration

**Operating system**:
Win 10, Visual Studio Code
 
**PlatformIO Version** (`platformio --version`):
PlatformIO Core, version 6.1.5

### Description of problem

If a dependency is a tag on a git repository, the complete git repository is cloned. Depending on the repository the traffic and amount of files can be huge. This causes a long transfer and processing time which decreases the user experience.

Git repositories are used for development built and testing.

Example  `platformio.ini`:
```yaml
[env:heltec_wifi_kit_32]
platform = espressif32@^5.2.0
platform_packages =
  ; use a upstream tag
  framework-arduinoespressif32 @ https://github.com/espressif/arduino-esp32#5b61930bb732d70f8aaa650047b9752365c9698c
framework = arduino
board = heltec_wifi_kit_32
```

### Actual Results

Traffic: 2.4GByte

### Expected Results

Traffic: 260MByte
-> 10 times less

### Solution hint

If possible use the `--depth=1` argument from `git` to only clone the necessary files.
Ref: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone

issue.title: fix(webapp): disable inline font
issue.body:
Disable inline font to improve FCP (first contentful paint).
Disable to avoid violating CSP rules.

Obsoletes #629

comment.body:
> Your measurements (fix(webapp): disable inline font #630 (comment)) indicate that disabling font inlining gains about 0.4s to first contentful paint.

The time reduction comes from the traffic reduction from 767 KiB to 696 KiB.

> However, even with inline fonts currently enabled, I do see the font being replaced shortly after first contentful paint, so there is flickering despite of font inlining.

There is no explicit `font inline` function. It is the generic webpack function: inline tiny files to reduce request to server.

> That indicates that the inline font is actually not used for the first contentful paint.

Yes, you are right.

>  or because the browser doesn't use it for another reason, 

The reason is that not used fonts char-set (greek-ext)  are inlined.

>  in which case the question is why the technology exists at all.

Because webpack makes the decision to inline only by the file size.

commits.message:
fix(api): update credentials_changed when (unused) TOTP is created

Previously, credentials_changed was only updated when the factor was
first verified. As a result, when an activation link was clicked
twice, the state was unchanged, so the action would attempt to create
the factor again, causing a uniqueness error.

Our `exception_handler` (exception_handlers.py) correctly turned this
into a 409 response, but the ugly database message was exposed, and
an admin email was triggered.

With this commit, the auth action state is invalidated immediately
when the TOTP factor is created.
fix(docs): trailing slash was missing for zonefile/ endpoint
fix(api): properly test and document login failures
fix(webapp): don't force MFA redirect on 403 due to login failure
feat(dyndns): allow preserving IP address, fixes #445
fix(webapp): correct return type of validation rule
refactor(webapp): code style, including new slot syntax
feat(docs): link zonefile export in bulk operations
feat(webapp): stay logged in on public pages, closes #619
fix(webapp): fix no-data slot positioning in domain view

issue.title: CI: Replace deprecated and non-functional travis-ci.org
issue.body:
travis-ci.org stopped working since June 2021:

> Since June 15th, 2021, the building on travis-ci.org is ceased. Please use travis-ci.com from now on. 
> - https://travis-ci.org/github/primefaces/primeng

This means that pull requests and other branches are not built and tested, thus creating a risk for code quality and reproducibility for this project. I suggest to either set up https://app.travis-ci.com/github/primefaces/primeng (note the other domain name) or switch to [GitHub actions](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions).

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

comment.body:
Yes it is still possible to pin to start with windows. But the underling technique are changed.
Microsoft is now are more committed to standards and PWAs.
They launched the test and support page https://www.pwabuilder.com/ .

If you dig into the documentation, you will finally find the following document with the corresponding resolutions:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/progressive-web-apps-chromium/how-to/icon-theme-color

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

comment.body:
I think (couldn't find a lot of information) at the time it was added, the yandex browser was not chromium based and so used a unique icon size.

> it has a unique feature named [Tableau](https://browser.yandex.com/help/personalization/tableau.html).

Opera has a similar looking feature. Also the icons seem not to be squares?

I think Russian focused developers have much more detailed information on how the yandex browser currently behaves and can share it.

@me-no-dev Should I increase the column size? The limitation was on purpose because it is easier to read a table row without a huge space between the columns. Most SSIDs were shorter than 15 chars on my test setup.

issue.title: Deprecate Windows 8 tile icons
issue.body:
## Problem

The title are only used on Windows 8 and Internet Explorer. Both are end of life.
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/windows-81
* https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/products/internet-explorer-11

## Solution

* Deprecate the option

issue.title: Deprecate yandex icon?
issue.body:
## Problem

It seems that the yandex **browser** icon is not relevant anymore.

The generation was introduced with #21 in 2014. But there is no documentation or reference.

Today the browser is just another chromium based browser. So the requirements should not be different.
Source: `Blink web browser engine and is based on the Chromium open source project` https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandex_Browser

## Solution

A. Find documentation and add it to this project.
or
B. Deprecate the option.

## Additional note

While research I found following maybe important information about favicons and yandex **search engine**:

> Recommendations on the format and size of favicons
> Size: 120 × 120, 32 × 32, or 16 × 16 pixels.
> Format: SVG (recommended), ICO, GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP. Animation is not supported.

https://yandex.com/support/webmaster/search-results/favicon.html

### Related area

Example

### Hardware specification

All

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

Simple examples are often used for quick debugging or function testing.

But currently the output of the `WiFiScan` example is not very useful:

```
Setup done
scan start
scan done
17 networks found
1: IoTNetwork (-62)*
2: WiFiSSID (-62)*
3: B3A7992 (-63)*
```

It does not show what the esp32 board recognizes, like encryption or channel.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add more useful data to the output.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

_No response_
